bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John M. Willis, February 10, 1941

div1.p: Hench requests photographs showing the Camp Columbia model, which he wishes to copy and distribute to interested parties, including Truby and Kean.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John M. Willis, February 10, 1941
div1.opener:
Y. F.
February 10, 1941
Colonel John M. Willis
Acting Commandant
Medical Field Service School
Carlisle Barracks
Carlisle, Pennsylvania
My dear Colonel Willis:
div1.p:
I appreciate very much indeed your sending me the photographs
of the model of Camp Columbia, set up in the new way. These photographed films
are labeled Q23, Q24, Q25, and Q26. Would you be willing to send me these films
temporarily in order that I may have a number of copies made of them? In par-
ticular, I wish to send a copy to General Albert E. Truby of San Francisco, who
in 1900 was commanding officer of this post hospital where the work of Walter Reed
was done. He is helping me identify these buildings, and it was he who indicated
the proper set-up of the model. I am also anxious to send a copy to General
Jefferson R. Kean, who was one of Walter Reed's best friends in 1900 when General
Kean was Major and Chief Surgeon of the division where Columbia Barracks was. I
also want a set to send to His Excellency, Dr. Ramos, the Minister of Defense of
Cuba, who has asked me to help him identify the site of these buildings. The
only think that remains now is the railroad track. If I could have the films I
would have the extra copies made here in our Clinic, in order that I could send
them to the survivors of the experiments, and have their help in identifying the
various buildings.

If you cannot permit this film to leave your department, would it
be possible to have an extra set made for me at my expense, or have several copies
of each made for me, and I shall be very glad to pay the expense. It would of
course be easier for me to simply have the copies made here.

Permit me to express again my sincere appreciation for your help
in this matter.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
